judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Allocatur is granted, the Order of the Superior Court is reversed, the Order of the Court of Quarter Sessions of Philadelphia County is vacated and the case is remanded to the Court of Quarter Sessions of Philadelphia County for further proceedings in accordance with the views expressed in the dissenting opinion of Judge Spaulding in Commonwealth v. Bell, 213 Pa. Superior Ct. 59, at 60-63 (1968).
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Francis Shunh Brown, III, for appellant.
James D. Crawford, Assistant District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Bell, Appellant.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Francis Shunh Brown, III, for appellant.
James D. Crawford, Assistant District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
November 29, 1968:
